Ranveer Singh Knew The Audience Will Appreciate Him, If He Played The Alauddin Khilji Part Well
Ranveer Singh Knew The Audience Will Appreciate Him, If He Played The Alauddin Khilji Part Well
Bollywood actor Ranveer Singh has had an eventful year. The beginning of the year saw his mega release Padmaavat where for the first time in a long time, we saw an A-lister hero play the role of a villain.
Screengrab
The year ended with a bigger bang when he tied the knot with another leading superstar Deepika Padukone. Yes, he broke the stereotype by getting married at the peak of his career.
The man has definitely lived this year with a lot of firsts. He is gearing up for his upcoming release, Simmba opposite Sara Ali Khan. Ranveer's career graph includes Lootera, Ram-leela, Bajirao Mastani and Padmaavat.
Asked if he would ever play a similar role and he said, not anytime soon. In fact, not many know but Ranveer was advised by many people to not play Khilji.

screengrab
"The rationale behind that was pretty convincing. They rationalized saying how audiences are very emotional, they even draw lines between actors and stars. If they love a character, they will shower the love on who played the character and if they hate the character, that hate will come upon the actor."
But we're glad the 33-year-old thought otherwise.
Twitter
"I trusted the audience, I trusted their maturity and the fact that they have evolved over time that they can see the performance for what it is. I felt that if I do this part well, they will appreciate me as an actor. I'm glad I trusted the audience and my trust in them paid off. It was a huge risk, but I'm never one to play it safe. So I'm glad I took the risk," he concluded.
(Inputs from IANS)
